title: how strong is Mordekaiser?
body: So the Morde’s updated Lore has came out and I would like to know how strong is Mordekaiser compared to the Ascended, Darkins, aspects(Zoe, Panth), and Demi-gods (Ornn and Volibear)?

replies.body: Well he’s basically a god of death.

I think god of death would imply he is a creator or influencer of it. Or that he carries it out. Which is more Kindred's thing. 

In fact he defiles death so I think he wouldn't represent death at all.
Let's put it this way. Mordekaiser has a permanent foundation respawn in lore. Not even Kindred can kill him permanently.

he has the ability to take beings to the death realm so id assume he is pretty damn op

anything that deals in death has the potential to be above gods and ascended beings as everything can die

that's why i feel that stuff like {{champion:112}} {{champion:53}} {{champion:14}} {{champion:555}} {{champion:61}} {{champion:240}} (skaarl) might be trouble for morde, as they may stretch the definition of "alive" (or, in skaarls case, they are invincible)

> [{quoted}](name=ZackTheWaffleMan,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=m250ydx5,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2019-06-05T18:11:10.505+0000)
>
> that's why i feel that stuff like {{champion:112}} {{champion:53}} {{champion:14}} {{champion:555}} {{champion:61}} {{champion:240}} (skaarl) might be trouble for morde, as they may stretch the definition of "alive" (or, in skaarls case, they are invincible)

Even though Orianna, Viktor, and Blitzcrank are machines, or at least very close to being 100% robots, they still are killable. Orianna and Camille are kept alive by their robotic heart and maybe the same can be said about Viktor. And I'm sure Sion is stoppable by an extremely powerful mage.
while i'm sure that they can be *destroyed/defeated,* i'm saying that death in the traditional sense doesn't apply to them

Physically, he's at least strong enough to use that giant mace. So at least on par with the other characters who use giant weapons like Darius or Garen. In his story a standard knight is able to take a hit, so he's not extraordinarily strong. 
But he's also got the benefit of being partially immune to physical damage since he doesn't have flesh. Though since he is made of _iron_ when we know their world is advanced enough for _steel_, he's probably weak to especially strong blunt force and explosives. 

In regards to his magic, he doesn't actually destroy much. What he does certainly requires _powerful_ magic... but not necessarily _destructive_ magic. And in his story, the offensive magic he tries to use gets completely dispelled by Demacian steel. And we can assume it doesn't just negate _all_ magic, since Noxus just flat out wouldn't use mages if they weren't effective. 

I think it's safe to assume most of his strength comes from his necromancy. And while that isn't something to just shrug off, he isn't especially impressive solo.

> [{quoted}](name=The Ecdysiast,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=m250ydx5,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2019-06-05T11:13:55.211+0000)

A lot of that is from his old lore, which isn't canon anymore. Current Morde only has one piece of lore dedicated to him.
No, they just recently updated the lore and bio on his Universe page. This is from that.
His color story is still the old one and currently outdated. The new one will be released when his rework hits live servers.

The story is irrelevant. That's the story for old morde, they're using at a placeholder until new morde's story is finished. Mordekaiser is at least on par with azir now, with his world-building magical power. He also knows waaaaaayyy more about the world than pretty much everybody except maybe ryze and the aspects. Also, at this point he's basically immortal because his soul can't die, and he'll always come back.

> And in his story, the offensive magic he tries to use gets completely dispelled by Demacian steel. And we can assume it doesn't just negate _all_ magic, since Noxus just flat out wouldn't use mages if they weren't effective. 


The OP asked about his lore update, and you basically told him to go fuck himself. 

This is not his lore anymore. He has no current interactions with Demacia in the brief lore that is currently canon.

> [{quoted}](name=The Ecdysiast,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=m250ydx5,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2019-06-05T11:13:55.211+0000)

And we can assume it doesn't just negate _all_ magic, since Noxus just flat out wouldn't use mages if they weren't effective. 
> 
> I think it's safe to assume most of his strength comes from his necromancy. And while that isn't something to just shrug off, he isn't especially impressive solo.

Wait what? They changed his story from literally soloing tribes over and over again until being overwhelmed then summoned again, basically holding his fortress all alone against thousands of people from various tribes, to not being able to kill a standard knight with 1 swing?

My bad, actually. Yes, they changed it from that to that. But even the newer story wasn't his _new_ lore. 

Although it's not like he was overwhelmed by hundreds or anything. At best, he was a very large man. Nothing superhuman about him. So it was at best 20, maybe 30 soldiers focused solely on him with a coordinated plan. 

Now, though, it doesn't actually say how he died. Old age or illness most likely, since it doesn't say anything about someone killing him.

> [{quoted}](name=The Ecdysiast,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=m250ydx5,comment-id=000200020000,timestamp=2019-06-25T18:30:47.001+0000)

> Now, though, it doesn't actually say how he died. Old age or illness most likely, since it doesn't say anything about someone killing him.

He was overwhelmed by hundred  tho. I don't know but he seemed like he was pretty big to me, he was only ever stopped when piles of people were literally thrown onto him. Back to the point, the artwork for the immortal bastion, atleast in my opinion makes it so that there were literally armies of different tribes just coming at him, and he was only ever stopped with overwhelming mass. Even then, he was always ressurected by his necromancers, and they only stopped him because someone stole his skull? (not sure). So yeah, the only thing i don't know is if the armor was made specifically for him before he died.

I'd say he's reasonably stronger, being just as immortal-if not more- than them. Morde could probably pull any of them to his world and kill them, keeping them dead. Although it all probably depends on how the death realm interacts with each of their 'immortalities'

The real question is does he get more power the more souls he has captured in his soul realm. It is kind of implied based on how his ultimate works in-game, stealing a portion of his enemies stats and keeping it if they die.

I would agree before he became Mordekaiser that would be true (when he was alive). But after he came back he learned alot of magic, enough that not even LeBlanc's (presumably their connection is still canon based on the updated lore) betrayal and an army could keep him down. I'd say he is at least on par with Azir in terms of power. As for how he would do against a Darkin, don't know. Both are equally as hard to kill.
We will have to wait for the rest of hi lore when he hits live servers

We don't really know, but it's heavily suggested that Swain's current main objective is to prepare the world for Mordekaiser's return by uniting it under the banner of Noxus. 
Since Swain is a man of reason and has gathered a lot of knowledge, he probably estimates Mordekaiser's strength to be somewhere between all of current Noxus and Valoran, Shurima, and Ionia combined.

Well, that'd be because any and all allies killed in action will become part of Mordekaiser's army.

Though I doubt Mordekaiser is the threat Swain is worried about. The Void is a threat to the entire universe, let alone Runeterra.

No, Swain specifically Saw a coming **Darkness** That he began to prepare for when he became Grand General. Assuming that the Demon Was around at the same time as Mordekaiser, That would probably be how he knows so much about Mordekaiser.

_Darkness_. As in, not bright green light. And if it were just similar to the Harrowing, that's not a detail they'd leave out. 

But you know what's dark? The Void. You know what's a huge threat that would require all nations to join together and fight, _including_ the Shadow Isles and other Death realms that may also be consumed by it? The Void. 

Mordekaiser's existence isn't a secret. So anyone with knowledge of history would know about him anyway. And if Swain were actually preparing for Mordekaiser, he'd be amassing weapons and magic like Lucian's guns specifically to fight undead.
Morde isn't shadow isle....
Exactly why I differentiated between the Shadow Isles and his realm. {{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}}
Too strong.
As strong as he needs to be to justify his busted gameplay
